snippet: The New York City Department of Investigation has rebuked a report submitted by the Department of Education that also recommended the firing of the therapist, Debra Fisher.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines absurdities of case against Debra Fisher, devoted occupational therapist in New York City school system who was suspended without pay in 2014 for conflicts of interest and theft of services; observes that charges are fruit of dysfunctional bureaucracy in Education Dept; notes Fisher's suspension and procedures that brought charges against her are under review.
lead_paragraph: The New York City Department of Investigation has rebuked a report submitted by the Department of Education that also recommended the firing of the therapist, Debra Fisher.

headline.print_headline: Bureaucratic Missteps at Many Turns in an Education Dept. Inquiry
headline.main: Major Flaws Found in Inquiry That Led to Suspension of Public-School Therapist
